description.narrative: National child protection systems, including justice for children, benefit from a strengthened regulatory framework aligned with international standards.

mailing-address.narrative: Maamari Street Gefinor Center Block E 5th Floor Beirut

sector.narrative: ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Lebanon 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Lebanon Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National child protection systems, including justice for children, benefit from a strengthened regulatory framework aligned with international standards.

description.narrative: Implementation of the Ministry of Social Affairs National Plan, including its official adoption, and the launch of national SOPs facilitated MoSA, enabled UNICEF Lebanon and its partners to enhance integrated programming, which covered protection, health and nutrition, justice and education, in collaboration with other key ministries. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2017

title.narrative: # of social workers and case workers trained and equipped to implement the National SOPs including MOSA social workers
# of social workers trainined in GBV
# of school counsellors trained on PSS package
# studies analysing the situation of boys and girls
# staff supported in government structures/ministries/other UN agencies
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Number of social service workers in the country
# contributions to CRC reporting process and to formal reports on armed conflict/armed violence grave violations against children

actual.value: 2017:7 contributions [CRC Report, 4 Global Horizontal Notes, Annual CAAC Report re MRM for Syria, Annual CAAC Report re MRM for Lebanon]

title.narrative: Development of CPIMS and referral protocol

actual.value: 2017:A CPIMS specialist is on board. An agreement was reached to use a global CPIMS platform contextualized to meet the requirement of Lebanon. Joint scoping mission completed, work-plan drafted for CPIMS development and roll out developed. Referral protocol: Internal Referral protocol for MoSA developed

title.narrative: # CP/GBV guidance, policies and tools endorsed by relevant line ministries (MOSA, MEHE, MoPH, MoL, MoJ)

actual.value: 2017:TORs were agreed by the NTTF. Waiting for official go ahead and choice of partner to undertake it. UNICEF Lebanon will follow up with Ministry of Social Affairs in January 2017.

title.narrative: # service providers trained of CP/GBV safe identification and referral /communicating with children and women
Harmonized IMS for CP case management developed
MOSA contracts with institutions according to international standards revised
Pilot conducted in selected SDCs implemented for MOSA-led National Technical Task force to end violence against women
Roadmap for the implementation of the UN Guidelines on Alternative Care produced

actual.value: 2016:Assessments completed to identify pilot safe spaces in 8 SDCs were conducted by UNICEF and its partner ABAAD and completed in April 2015.
2016:The consolidated 4th and 5th report is ready and submitted officially by the governement of Lebanon on the 6th of November 2015.

title.narrative: National SOPs on case management endorsed by MOSA and MoJ
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of routine administrative data collection systems and publications on violence, exploitation and abuse of children including violent deaths and injuries
